name: Primary Food Processors
membership:
PFP does not belong to any other federation but cooperates on an ad hoc basis with other organisations such as COPA-COGECA, FDE, COCERAL or FEFAC, with a view to strengthen the approaches and positions taken in the field of food and feed safety and industry supply.
PFP has joined the European Bioeconomy Alliance (EuBA) in 2014.
goal:
PFP's mission is to represent the European primary food processing industries'interests, at the level of both European and international institutions. In order to fulfill its mission, PFP has three principal functions:
1. to promote the European primary food processing industry's views to the European institutions, international organisations and other interested bodies;
2. to improve understanding of its operational requirements, especially in responding to Members of the European Parliament, European Commission's consultative bodies and services, international organisations' consultations and through liaison with other parties, in particular the European farmers and partners in the food supply chain;
3. to provide information and advice to its members on a wide range of common subjects
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Climate Action, Consumer Affairs, Customs, Development, Energy, Environment, External Relations, Food Safety, Trade, Transport
euInitiatives:
- Country of origin labelling (as part of FIC implementation)
- General Food Fitness Check (REFIT)
- Industrial policy; competitiveness
- Biobased economy
- Sustainability in food production; SCP Roundtable; PEF-pilots
- Trade negotiations, bilateral and multilateral
